segments.text: That looks like an interesting book .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It is . It ’ s got pictures of interesting building from all over the world , with brief descriptions of how they were build , their purpose , and so on .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: There are the pyramids . It ’ s easy to see how they got that name ! they don ’ t have smooth sides though .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They don ’ t now , but most of them did originally . There ’ s picture of the pentagon in the united states . It ’ s very distinctive with its five sides .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Look at that cylindrical office building . I ’ Ve never been seen one that shape before .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . Usually only TV towers are cylindrical in shape .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: TV towers are usually thicker at the bottom than at the top . They ’ re not perfectly cylindrical .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This is the world ’ s largest sports stadium . It ’ s a massive oval .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What sports do they play there ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It says here that it ’ s m mainly used for big football matches and athletics meetings .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is that building a perfect cube ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: According to the book , it is . I ’ Ve never seen a building that is a perfect cube . Look at the building . From the air , it looks like a square with a semi-circle attached to each of its four sides . What
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is says here that it ’ s a war memorial . Now , there ’ s a distinctive structure-the stomium in Brussels . See ? It consists of several connected by cylinders . I believe you can go up and down inside it .
segments.speaker: S1
